messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 63 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Voxel Structure-based Mesh Reconstruction from a 3D Point Cloud

Paper Abstract: Abstract Mesh reconstruction from a 3D point cloud is an important topic in the fields of computer graphic, computer vision, and multimedia analysis. In this paper, we propose a voxel structure-based mesh reconstruction framework. It provides the intrinsic metric to improve the accuracy of local region detection. Based on the detected local regions, an initial reconstructed mesh can be obtained. With the mesh optimization in our framework, the initial reconstructed mesh is optimized into an isotropic one with the important geometric features such as external and internal edges. The experimental results indicate that our framework shows great advantages over peer ones in terms of mesh quality, geometric feature keeping, and processing speed. The source code of the proposed method is publicly available111Code Link: github.com/vvvwo/Parallel-Structure-for-Meshing..

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 63 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 63"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Shape basis interpretation for monocular deformable 3-d reconstruction",
        "Adaptive online transmission of 3-d texmesh using scale-space and visual perception analysis",
        "Efficient fine-granular scalable coding of 3d mesh sequences",
        "Watermarked 3-d mesh quality assessment",
        "Reversible data hiding in encrypted three-dimensional mesh models",
        "Saliency detection for 3d surface geometry using semi-regular meshes",
        "Fast exact and approximate geodesics on meshes",
        "Nasal similarity measure of 3d faces based on curve shape space",
        "3d scanner integration with product development",
        "Point set surfaces",
        "Modern techniques and applications for real-time non-rigid registration",
        "Detail-preserving mesh unfolding for nonrigid shape retrieval",
        "Point cloud resampling using centroidal voronoi tessellation methods",
        "Surface reconstruction by parallel and unified particle-based resampling from point clouds",
        "Robust and high fidelity mesh denoising",
        "Visibility-consistent thin surface reconstruction using multi-scale kernels",
        "A greedy delaunay-based surface reconstruction algorithm",
        "Scale space meshing of raw data point sets",
        "Screened poisson surface reconstruction",
        "Computational surface flattening: a voxel-based approach",
        "Delaunay refinement algorithms for triangular mesh generation",
        "Paving: A new approach to automated quadrilateral mesh generation",
        "A multi-resolution topological representation for non-manifold meshes",
        "Creating large-scale city models from 3d-point clouds: a robust approach with hybrid representation",
        "Poisson surface reconstruction",
        "Sparse low-degree implicit surfaces with applications to high quality rendering, feature extraction, and smoothing",
        "Smoothing of partition of unity implicit surfaces for noise robust surface reconstruction",
        "Floating scale surface reconstruction",
        "Reconstructing manifold and non-manifold surfaces from point clouds",
        "Voxel-based quadrilateral mesh generation from point cloud",
        "A new voronoi-based surface reconstruction algorithm",
        "A simple algorithm for homeomorphic surface reconstruction",
        "The power crust",
        "A delaunay-based region-growing approach to surface reconstruction from unorganized points",
        "Reconstruction of water-tight surfaces through delaunay sculpting",
        "Surface reconstruction from unoriented point clouds by a new triangle selection strategy",
        "Shape-optimizing and illumination-smoothing image stitching",
        "On centroidal voronoi tessellation energy smoothness and fast computation",
        "Isotropic remeshing with fast and exact computation of restricted voronoi diagram",
        "Parallel l-bfgs-b algorithm on gpu",
        "Surface reconstruction by computing restricted voronoi cells in parallel",
        "Meshless voronoi on the gpu",
        "Uniformization and density adaptation for point cloud data via graph laplacian",
        "Robust feature-preserving mesh denoising based on consistent subneighborhoods",
        "Mesh denoising via cascaded normal regression",
        "Data-driven geometry-recovering mesh denoising",
        "A remeshing approach to multiresolution modeling",
        "lpsubscriptùëôùëùl_{p} centroidal voronoi tessellation and its applications",
        "Adaptive remeshing for real-time mesh deformation",
        "Isotropic surface remeshing without large and small angles",
        "Field-aligned isotropic surface remeshing",
        "Robust repair of polygonal models",
        "Mesh repair with user-friendly topology control",
        "Mesh arrangements for solid geometry",
        "Repairing man-made meshes via visual driven global optimization with minimum intrusion",
        "A comparison of perceptually-based metrics for objective evaluation of geometry processing",
        "Mesh-independent surface interpolation",
        "Octree-based point-cloud compression",
        "Fast marching farthest point sampling for implicit surfaces and point clouds",
        "Voronoi-based curvature and feature estimation from point clouds",
        "Surface mesh quality evaluation",
        "Surface reconstruction through point set structuring",
        "On normals and projection operators for surfaces defined by point sets"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 63 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Voxel Structure-based Mesh Reconstruction from a 3D Point Cloud, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
